CatDescriptText: Mr. Wilbert Scott, burner, Homewood and Mrs. Mary Coughlin, housewife, Bloomfield, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 26, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Should better medical care be provided for the aged through Social Security?"  Mr. Wilbert Scott's answer reads: "Yes, because the Social Security which they receive is so small there's not enough to cover the medical care.  So therefore medical care should be included in Social Security."  Mrs. Mary Coughlin's answer reads: "Some people say that old people want to lay in the hospital, but this is a lot of hooey...They want to pay they don't want something for nothing..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Wilbert Scott wearing straw fedora and suit, standing across from Specialty Luggage, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mary Coughlin wearing eyeglasses and short sleeve dress, holding paper bag, standing in front of SUN drug store, intersection of Liberty Avenue and Olga Way, Downtown
